member.name: T:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.Attributes.SwaggerExcludeAttribute
member.summary: Used to mark properties to be excluded from a Swagger schema by ../Swagger/ExcludeSchemaFilter.cs

member.name: T:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.Attributes.SwaggerIsTrackedARMResourceAttribute
member.summary: Used to mark a model as representing a tracked ARM resource

member.name: T:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.Attributes.SwaggerLinkToExampleAttribute
member.summary: Used to mark a controller method whose Swagger operation section will require a link to a file containing example requests and responses.The attribute sets the controller method name as the name of the example file by default, but you can also pass a custom filename in as a parameter. Processing of these attributes is done by ../Swagger/XmsExamplesOperationFilter.cs

member.name: T:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.Attributes.SwaggerLongRunningOperationAttribute
member.summary: Used to mark controller methods that may run asynchronously

member.name: T:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.Attributes.SwaggerRequireRequestBodyAttribute
member.summary: Used to mark controller methods that should be excluded from the operations in the Swagger spec

member.name: P:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.ResourceListResultModel`1.Value

member.name: T:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.Swagger.TrackedAzureResourceSchemaFilter
member.summary: Operation Filter to satisfy ARM API Rule 2062
member.remarks:
this will correct the following AutoRest error:
ERROR(XmsResourceInPutResponse/R2062/ARMViolation) : The 200 response model for an ARM PUT operation must have x-ms-azure-resource extension set to true in its hierarchy.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.Swagger.XmsExamplesOperationFilter
member.summary: Generate paths to example files
member.remarks: The example files themselves are hard-coded/>.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ArmSwashbuckleStarterKit.Swagger.XmsLongRunningOperationFilter
member.summary: Adds x-ms-long-running-operation extenstion to opertaion marked with . Some REST operations can take a long time to complete. Although REST is not supposed to be stateful, some operations are made asynchronous while waiting for the state machine to create the resources, and will reply before the operation on resources are completed. When x-ms-long-running-operation is specified, there should also be a x-ms-long-running-operation-options specified. x-ms-long-running-operation-options: string - one of azure-async-operation or location or original-uri.

member.summary: Fetches a weather forecast

The public ID of the forecast
